Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [picks up pencil between his toes]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Twenty minutes a day Jim, that's all it takes. Twenty minutes a day, all feet, no hands and I'll have the pedi-dexterity of a chimp, and you'll be sitting there like an idiot. [attempts to place pencil in pencil sharpener] Okay. Here we go. Ah, yes. [accidentally kicks items from his desk onto Pam's]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Do you mind?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm sorry Pam, allow me to write you an apology letter.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You don't have to do that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [typing with his toes] D-E-A. Oop, backspace. A. Dear.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [whistling, places cup of coffee onto Dwight's desk] Ahh, Thank you hands. Nothing else in the universe can do what you do.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [lifts cup up with toes]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, don't worry about it. Dwight, its okay. You were wrong.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [spills hot coffee on himself] Uhh, aah!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, A for effort right?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [taps Jim's hand with his foot]

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: Welcome, start your morning right with a burst of blueberry. Or try plain.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What's the occasion?

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: Dwight said this entry was a waste of space.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I would like a muffa du blueberry por favor.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: Eight dollars.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Eight dollars?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Owning a building is a war between the landlord and the tenant. Not a literal war, unfortunately, but I am using the same tactics. I've surrounded the enemy, and I'm slowly starving them. To save on electricity I've installed a timer and motion sensors on the lights. It's part of my green initiative. And by green, I mean money.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [examines items on the reception desk] Mmhmm, China. China.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: How was the dentist?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It was great. China.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Are you okay, what's wrong?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Everything here was made in China, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, its where they make stuff.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They used to make stuff in America, Andy. But we're falling behind, did you know that? China is a sleeping dragon that is just beginning to stir.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, no.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, right here. It is right there. [holds up magazine] Anybody read the news any more?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: China is on the move?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I found that in the waiting room at the dentist's office. This kid had the magazine I wanted to read, that's the only one I could reach and I read it and then I read it again.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: My whole life I believed that America was number one, that was the saying. Not America is number two. England is number two. China should be like eight.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey Darryl.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You gotta stop texting me so much.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: But I wanted you to know that Michael and I are wearing the same tie today. It's insane.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You need to change your standard for what's worthy of a text. Ask yourself is this something Darryl needs to know. The answers almost always no.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Got it. Then I will call you.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: There was a time when the only people who texted you were people you wanted to text you. Girls. And they'd all say the same thing. "I'm coming over baby." And I would text back "BTB", bring that booty.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Dwight, why is the toilet paper only half a ply?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, isn't that good enough for your anus? Don't get me started on how coddled the modern anus is.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Umm, Stanley. Maybe you could just unspool a little more each time you need to...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Don't tell me how to do my business.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Stanley, as a fellow Dunder Mifflin employee I feel for you. But, like you, I am completely powerless to the whims of the new building owner.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Which is you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: "Which is you" is not a sentence.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I disagree with.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Are you just gonna sit there, Office Administrator, or are you going to do something?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight, can we talk about these cutbacks.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pam, when I'm sitting at this desk, I'm a salesman. If you wanna talk to the new building owner, you should call Nate and schedule and appointment.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm not going to do that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well then you're not going to talk to the new building owner. Which is a shame, because I hear he's a very reasonable guy.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Y'ello.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hi Nate, Its Pam Halpert.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: Oh, hey Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, I would just love to schedule a meeting today with Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: Let me put you on hold for just one 'eensy sec.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [answers phone] Dwight Schrute. Mhm. Tell her I'm busy. I don't know, make something up.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: Hey Pam, Dwight's being questioned by the police in connection with a string of dog-nappings that ha...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [hangs up phone] Dwight. Dwight. Can you please tell new building owner that he is screwing over all the people he works with, people he's worked with for years. His friends.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know what Pam? You're right. This isn't just a business. This is a home, and I would much rather see a smile from Kevin than save hundreds on plumbing and electricity. [Kevin smiles]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh my God.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: According to the internet, the tallest man in the world is Chinese.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So much for keeping our secrets up high.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: What's America gonna do?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know what we're going to do. We're going to put our best minds on it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Everybody stop working. I want you all to imagine a world in which America is not the number one superpower, where forks are irrelevant, and where every man, woman and child is expected to learn how to play the cello. Now open your eyes.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You never told us to close them.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Welcome to your future.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What do we do? How do we stop this?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How do we stop it? With a big idea. That's what America is built on, big ideas. Blue jeans, the Grand Canyon. Whose got one, whose got a big idea?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: An idea bigger than the Grand Canyon?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, indeed. Yes Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: An antacid that you only take once a week.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Once a week antacid is the idea to beat. Anyone else? Nobody? Okay then we are... yes.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Michael! An antacid pill that you take once every six weeks.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Why not just go one for the year?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: It's too big of a pill to swallow.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: What if we all get together and help each other and hire a new guy, and then we all kill him, but first we take out like a hundred thousand dollar life insurance policy. I bet you guys like that idea don't you?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I think that's what they're doing to me. I can't prove it, but I wanted to see their faces when I said it. I learned nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know what the [expletive] that was.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I say we bomb 'em. By 2020, they're gonna be the world's largest economy and they're getting a taste for protein. We'll all starve.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah, Dwight's right we should drop a bomb.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No he's not right. We're not. Where would we even drop it, Phyllis? Did you know that in China there are fifty six cities with over a million people? You know how many we have here? Nine.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [gasps]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Actually, that's not true. I know the figure you're referring to, and it's a projection of fifteen years from now.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Thank God.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no. That is right now.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael, China's agrarian. Urbanizing fast? You bet 'cha, but still agrarian.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: In terms of land, not population.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Come on Michael. You can...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no you're wrong about this.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Where are you getting this information?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I got it from NewYorkTimes.com

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Uh oh, getting nervous Oscar?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, someone look it up.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm on it Jim. I'm on it.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Guys its not worth it really. Guys this is not worth our time.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [reads text] "Are you watching this?" Seriously?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well are you?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I'm sitting right here.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Got it. China has fifty six cities with a population of over one million. The US has... nine.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Suck it Oscar.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well on the plus side all this worrying about China has made you smarter than Oscar, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Great. I was wrong. I'm wrong. Is everyone happy?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So I happen to know more than the smartest guy in the office. So what? [laughs] I don't care.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, now where were we before I bested Oscar?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Wow, so this building can get uglier.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I will not work in a roach billboard.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Oh my God, I can't look at roaches.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Michael do something about this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Absolutely, Pam this is exactly why I hired you as Office Administrator, handle it. Taking care of business.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight take it down.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm serious, take it down or else.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Or else? Or else what? There's nothing you can do.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We can move out.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [lights turn off] Really? [jumps to try and activate motion sensor, Kevin walks through the door setting it off, and the lights come back on]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So, does anyone wanna know where I've been for the last 2 hours?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh God, I've been playing Zombie Soccer for two hours?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I went out to look for a better office space.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Waste of time.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Not really, because I found one.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh wow, these are nice.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yup.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let me see.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Look at the huge offices Jim, check out that conference room.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah. Totally.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You can't just move out.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh in three months we can. Check the lease, and if you don't undo all the changes you've made, we're moving. Hey guys, can I show you some pictures.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [without looking at the pictures] Oh my gosh she is so cute. She looks like both of you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: They're not of Cece.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, cool.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: This is possibly our new Dunder Mifflin office.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Well I like being in the same building as Bob. Keeps me honest.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, this building isn't far, and its much newer. There's a dry cleaner, nail place and a gym. Oh, and it's next-door to and Outback so it always smells like steak.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Are you trying to kill me?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Is the nail place Koreans or whites?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Koreans.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Good. And the dry cleaners?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: White.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Woah, there is a lot of brainpower in this room. We've got Michael and Oscar, the two smartest guys in the office, also in that order.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Funny Jim. That is funny.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Very comedically humorous Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I have a computer question. Hey Oscar?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What is it?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Can you move aside so that I can ask Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Alright. Alright I get it.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Michael, how do I create a new tab?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Try 'Control P'.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: That's print.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Not if the printer isn't hooked up. You are making some very dangerous assumptions Oscar.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oscar it must be killing you to know that Michael is smarter than you.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: He's... he's not smarter than me, he was just right about one thing.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah, but it was a really smart thing to be right about, actually.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Actually, it was.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Around here, Oscar is known as 'actually' because he will insert himself into just about any conversation to add facts, or correct grammar. He really does fit that old stereotype of the smug gay Mexican.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [reading text] Megan Fox. Question mark. What's that mean?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Megan Fox! Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You know what, you're one bad text away from getting blocked.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes, but one good text away from a high five.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You accept these terms?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, its on.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: In your perfect would, what would make this building awesome? I'm putting together kind of a wish list.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well, I wish for a million wishes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, no. I'm not a genie. I'm just talking about a...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Then see you later building.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You can't possibly be serious.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I said see you later building.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hey Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I was thinking about some of the stuff you said earlier about China.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmm.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'd love to talk more about it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Maybe over some coffee later?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Woah, woah, woah. Do you know what you just agreed to?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Coffee Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It is not just coffee.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He's trying to set you up Michael. What's going to happen is he's going to try and bring up what ever you're talking about in a very casual way, but secretly he'll be trying to trip you up, and when he does, boom, its awful. Haven't you noticed that I don't bring up the Tour de France around him?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And then he will smugly pay the cheque and make you feel so small.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, well I just need to learn everything about China. To be safe I should learn everything about everything but I don't have time. Okay, okay, I'll just learn about China and science and geography and math and literary.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No politics?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm pretty good on politics. "California is bankrupt, and California, California." [Jim and Andy follow Michael into his office] What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Parley, my office, five minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Parley?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Pirate code, he wants to meet.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So everyone here knows pirate code?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I understand it, I can't speak it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pam, I am not an unreasonable man. If you guys stay, I will stop watering down the soap.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You've been watering down the soap?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why do you even need soap? Are you that bad at going to the bathroom?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We need everything back the way it was.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You don't wanna move. Moving is one of the most stressful things you can do in life. You'll probably just take it out on your kid. Jim will turn to the drink. The family will fall apart, and twenty five years from now, Cece will become world famous... for stripping.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's a sad story. I have another one. We move, the other tenants follow, the bank takes the building, takes your farm, takes your car and beats the crap out of you. Penniless, you die, and my daughter Cece dances on your grave... fully clothed. [lights turn off, Pam and Dwight begin to wave their arms to alert the sensor]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Where is Tibet?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pass.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: When was China founded?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pass.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Two for two, keep it up.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Who is Mao?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Lifeline.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Damn it. Michael, you are moments away from the smack down of your life. If you don't know something, steer the conversation back to something you do know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I could talk about boobs. I bet he knows nothing about boobs.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What do you know about boobs?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Michael, I have to tell you something it's from Rocky II.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This guy doesn't just wanna win. Y'know, he want's to bury you. He wants to humiliate you!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wait, wait, wait. How long is this going to take?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm like a quarter of the way through.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Is it going to be worth it?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Just in case Michael, I made you a cheat sheet.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't need to cheat.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Show him how to use it.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: [riding in car, looking for new office] Ten thousand seven hundred and six.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Here it is, right here, pull over. Oh my God. No way. Man, look at that.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There's no building. This could only mean one thing.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: The building's underground?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: She was lying. Oh, Pam, Pam...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight & Nate
Quote.Text: Pam, Pam, Pam, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Passer-by
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: Pam. Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Passer-by
Quote.Text: I'm Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: No you're not.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm sorry. We have a colleague with the same name.

Quote.Speaker: Passer-by
Quote.Text: Oh, that's fine.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So, okay. You're not a liar too are you?

Quote.Speaker: Passer-by
Quote.Text: I've been known to bend the truth.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Damn it, Pam. Get out. Right now. Leave it, I mean it. Get the hell out of here. Go.

Quote.Speaker: Passer-by
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can't wait to do to Pam, what I just did... to Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Y'know what, I'm the only one here who you haven't asked about the new office.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know, because you're the reason we're moving.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, but I'm still an employee here, and that part of me is really excited about the change of scenery. What's the square footage in the new place?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uhh, I think it's something like umm...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What's the exact square footage.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Umm, let me see.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How many offices are there? Oh I'll just look at the one sheet myself.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, actually I don't know what I did with the one sheet. Y'know, that's the problem. You only have one sheet.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [chuckles] You're a funny guy Pam. What's the first thing you guys are gonna do when you move in to the new office? I'm going to walk down the hall and say "Wow, I can't believe this is real, but it is." I can't wait.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mmhmm.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I lied about some aspects of the building.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's still on a bike path though right?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: There's no building... it doesn't exist.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What does that mean?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I needed leverage so I pulled those pictures off the internet. It's just this Office Administrator thing, I don't wanna...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Fail. I don't want to fail... again.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But you didn't fail.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And that's what you said about Art School, and that's what you said about sales.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And you didn't fail those things either.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, I'm not an artist, and I'm not a salesman. So what would you call it?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, hey, hey, hey, hey.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael, the reason I asked you down here for this chat is that I've been thinking that your fears about China are a bit exaggerated.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Did you know, that China has a new missile, that can sink a US Naval Carrier nine hundred miles off the coast?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: We have missiles too.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Did you also know that China has secretly been expanding its nuclear arsenal. But what do I know, I mean, that's just according to the Pentagon. Our Pentagon.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: I wasn't here. [places a book in front of Pam]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: I wasn't here. It's a pretty common saying. You may want to log it away for future use.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: China has been loaning us billions upon billions of dollars. We are going to be owing them for the rest of our lives. And they will control us.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Actually, we're in a mild recession right now. I'll give you that, but people use China as the boogie man for all their problems. In the nineteen eighties, it was Japan.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How then do you explain that in the past year manufacturing in China has risen by 17% and in the US it has only risen by 8%?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Do you really think that manufacturing is a relevant indicator of where the world economy's heading in 2011? Do you know the comparative expansion of say the information sector? I'd say that's far more relevant. Wouldn't you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't... I...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hello, hello. You're breaking the law.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Impossible, I love the law.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Read article nineteen. There are suitable standards that you have to maintain the building at that includes comfortable temperatures and adequate lighting. It also means no more cutting the tampons in two, and no more tampering with the toilet paper.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I see I've underestimated you, and I didn't think that was possible. Nate, reply the paper.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: I don't think it goes that way.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Reply it!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Don't worry about the coffee, its on me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I figured that.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael, I am so happy that we were able to have this little chat.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wait. You forgetting something?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This chat. Two men, one white, one latina. A boss and a money cruncher. I could fire you.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Fire him. No, show mercy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here we are.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What's your point.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: My point is... that as long as people like you and me don't stop talking, nobody can stop the USA.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. [clapping]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Right, yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am talking about freedom, about choice. America, I don't think you need to worry. Because if you want to beat China you will. If you don't, that's fine. That my friend, is your victory. Y'know, a lot of people say if you dig long enough and hard enough you will get to China, and that may be the true, but what they don't tell you is that if you dig long enough and hard enough in a conversation, you get to a friend. So here is to conversation.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: That's not.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Raise your cups on high. Case closed.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: That wasn't what we were discu... That wasn't the whole...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: They say the best vampires don't bleed their victims dry, but give them the strength so that they can bounce back only to be fed on again. I spared Pam, and I may feast off of her profits for years to come. I let Pam win. Haha, oh. I was not motivated by compassion. I have no compassion. Make sure you got that. Not motivated by compassion.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [reads text] Come to parking lot. Crazy pigeon action?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Shhh. You're gonna scare 'em away. [two pigeons are eating out of a soft serve cone]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [laughs] That's a text. [high fives Andy]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. Right.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That's your new standard.
